intro.title: Optimize Your Company Car Benefits
intro.description: Use our calculator to compare free car benefit, limited car benefit, and kilometer compensation options. Make informed decisions about your company's vehicle policy based on accurate data.

calculator.title: Car Benefit Calculator
calculator.description: Adjust the parameters below to see how different options affect costs for both the employer and employee. The calculator provides real-time comparisons based on current tax regulations.

freeBenefit.description: Free car benefit means the employer pays for all costs related to the car, including fuel for private use.
freeBenefit.advantage3: No need to track private vs. business mileage
freeBenefit.consideration2: May not be cost-effective for low annual mileage
freeBenefit.consideration3: Less incentive for efficient driving habits

limitedBenefit.description: Limited car benefit means the employer provides the car, but the employee pays for fuel used in private driving.
limitedBenefit.advantage1: Lower taxable benefit for the employee
limitedBenefit.consideration1: Requires tracking of business vs. private mileage

kmAllowance.title: Kilometer Allowance
kmAllowance.description: Instead of a company car, employees use their own car and receive a tax-free kilometer allowance for business travel.
kmAllowance.rate: Current rate: 0.53 €/km for the first 5,000 km, 0.48 €/km thereafter
kmAllowance.advantage3: Flexibility in vehicle choice for employees
kmAllowance.consideration1: Requires detailed record-keeping of business trips
kmAllowance.consideration2: Total costs can be higher with significant business travel
kmAllowance.consideration3: Employee bears the risk of vehicle ownership

tip1.title: Choose Electric or Hybrid Vehicles
tip1.description: Lower taxable values and reduced operational costs make electric and hybrid vehicles an excellent choice for company car fleets.

tip2.title: Match Car to Actual Needs
tip2.description: Select vehicles that match actual business requirements rather than opting for prestige models with unnecessary features.

tip3.title: Consider Annual Mileage
tip3.description: For employees with high annual mileage, free car benefit often becomes more cost-effective than limited benefit.

tip4.title: Implement Clear Policies
tip4.description: Create clear company car policies that help optimize costs while meeting employee needs.

taxInfo.title: Tax Information
taxInfo.description: Current car benefit taxation rules in Finland for 2023-2024. These values are used in the calculator's estimations.
taxInfo.disclaimer: Note: For precise tax planning, always consult a tax professional as regulations may change.

freeBenefit.title: Free Car Benefit
freeBenefit.formula: Monthly taxable value = Base value + 1.4% of replacement price

limitedBenefit.title: Limited Car Benefit
limitedBenefit.formula: Monthly taxable value = Base value + 1.4% of replacement price - fuel cost adjustment

electricVehicles.title: Electric Vehicles
electricVehicles.description: For all-electric vehicles (BEV), the taxable value is reduced by €170/month (2023).

questions.question1: What's the difference between free and limited car benefit?
questions.answer1: With free car benefit, the employer covers all car-related costs including fuel for private use. With limited car benefit, the employee pays for the fuel used for private driving. This results in different tax implications and overall cost structures.
questions.answer2: The calculator uses current Finnish tax regulations and standard cost estimates. While it provides a good approximation, actual costs may vary based on specific circumstances. For precise financial planning, consult our leasing experts.
questions.question3: Can I use this calculator for electric vehicles?
questions.answer3: Yes, the calculator takes into account the special tax benefits for electric vehicles in Finland. When calculating with electric vehicles, adjust the fuel consumption to represent electricity costs per km.
questions.question4: How often are the tax values updated?
questions.answer4: We update our calculator whenever the Finnish Tax Administration releases new car benefit values, typically annually. The current calculator reflects the 2023-2024 values.
